item.title: gross register tons
item.description:
Read some interesting things (once again) about Docker yesterday:

Why Docker? Why Not Chef? - Very interesting read.

Cocaine - PasS from yandex.ru, build around docker. (techcrunch)

Plus many more the last months...

Docker is the reason, I've started developing again on my local machine, ditching aws micro-instances when possible. It makes vagrant (read vmware or virtualbox) looking old, at least from a developers perspective. Minimal footprint, fast; but nevertheless totally encapsulated - great!

For example: I had to try out things with ElasticSearch yesterday. I've installed a running container within minutes with one command and evaluated the things I had to. Easy going.

Disclaimer: Developers using Mac won't problably get this, but that's not my problem :)

item.title: Things I like (1)
item.description: Open-Source projects, which are responsive on bug reports. 45 minutes later it is fixed and a new version is released.

item.title: github is slooooowww
item.description: After months of using github rarely, I've have to say it's slower than never. Even on an european monday morning the frontend is crawling slowly... Luckily gitpages on github.io are fast. Nice. (But, ouch, this doesn't help when I can't push this little blogpost...)

item.title: Auf dem Weg in die Agrargesellschaft
vim
item.description: A test, blogging with VIM over ssh from tablet. Don't know yet, if I'll stick with nikola.

item.title: Über euer scheiß Mittelmeer käm ich, wenn ich ein Turnschuh wär.
item.description:
Über euer scheiß Mittelmeer käm ich, wenn ich ein Turnschuh wär.
Oder als Flachbild-Scheiß - ich hätte wenigstens ein' Preis.
Es gäb' für uns kein Halten mehr, wir kämen immer nur schneller her.
Ich seh die Waren zieh'n, ohne zu flieh'n gehen sie an Land...
...gehen sie an Land - als Verheißungslieferant, (Vorführ)Meinungspraktikant,
Rückweisungsversand, Abwicklungsgarant

Goldene Zitronen - Wenn ich ein Turnschuh wär
